topic: How to containerize batch jobs using fastapi with Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to containerize batch jobs using fastapi with Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Containerizing Batch Jobs Using FastAPI in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide demonstrates how to containerize and manage batch jobs effectively using FastAPI, a modern web framework for building APIs in Python 3.12+. We will utilize the power of containers to isolate our applications from other processes and leverage Docker to automate the deployment and scaling.
key_points: FastAPI: A modern, high-performance web framework for building APIs.
Python 3.12+: The latest version of Python offering improved performance and features.
Containerization: Isolating applications from other processes using containers.
Docker: An open-source platform for automating the deployment, scaling, and management of applications.

code_examples.code:
FROM python:3.12
WORKDIR /app
COPY . /app
RUN pip install fastapi uvicorn
CMD ["uvicorn", "main:app", "--host", "0.0.0.0", "--port", "80"]

version_notes: Python 3.12 is the latest version at the time of writing and offers improvements in performance, speed, and usability.
FastAPI version 0.73.0 is used in this example.
caveats: Ensure your system has Docker installed before proceeding with containerization.
This example assumes that you have a Job class and its associated logic implemented elsewhere.
Remember to customize the application's port, host, and other configuration options as needed.
